Manager - Global Compliance and Reporting (GCR) Job at Ernst & Young (EY)




        
    

        
        Ernst & Young (EY) is a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services. The insights and quality services we deliver help build trust and confidence in the capital markets and in economies the world over. We develop outstanding leaders who team to deliver on our promises to all of our stakeholders. In so doing, we play a critical role in building a better working world for our people, for our clients and for our communities.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:  Manager - Global Compliance and Reporting (GCR)

Requisition ID: 1593129
Job Location: Lagos

Role Overview
     

            
    




	The successful candidate will be responsible for ensuring compliance with local and international tax regulations, providing tax audit and controversy support services, and preparing various financial reports.
	This position encompasses a wide range of service offerings within the GCR Unit for Non-oil companies.


Key Responsibilities


	Prepare, review and submit tax returns in compliance with relevant laws and regulations.
	Identify and mitigate tax-related risks, implementing robust controls and processes.
	Provide support in Tax Controversy matters, assisting clients in navigating disputes with tax authorities.
	Handle Income Tax Compliance, ensuring accurate reporting and adherence to local and international tax laws.
	Manage Tax Accounting, Provisioning, and Reporting, ensuring accurate tax provisions and compliance with relevant standards.
	Manage Accounting Compliance & Reporting (ACR) processes, ensuring all compliance obligations are met.
	Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual accounting reports according to International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS), include compilation of annual statutory reports in line with IFRS provisions.
	Oversee Payroll Operations, ensuring compliance with payroll tax regulations and timely submissions.
	Lead and mentor a team of tax professionals, promoting a collaborative culture.
	Collaborate with clients to understand their needs and deliver tailored solutions across all service offerings.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree (BSc/HND) in Accounting, Finance, Law, or a related field (minimum of 2.1/upper credit).
	4 - 6 years of relevant experience in tax and accounting compliance & reporting, with a strong track record in a senior role.
	Professional or postgraduate qualifications (ICAN, ACCA, CITN, MBA) are advantageous.
	Strong knowledge of local and international tax regulations and IFRS.
	Excellent analytical, problem-solving, communication, and interpersonal skills.
	Proven ability to manage multiple clients and projects simultaneously.
	Proficiency in accounting software and Microsoft Office Suite.
	A knowledge of Oil and Gas is an Added advantage. 


Work Environment:


	The position offers a dynamic and inclusive work environment, emphasizing collaboration and high performance.
	This role is ideal for seasoned professionals looking to advance their careers in tax compliance and reporting within a reputable organization, with a comprehensive understanding of all service offerings in the GCR Unit of EY.

  "description": "DP World - We exist to make the world&rsquo;s trade flow better, changing what&rsquo;s possible for the customers and communities we serve globally. With a dedicated, diverse and professional team of more than 108,100 employees spanning 74 countries on six continents. We are pushing trade further and faster towards a seamless supply chain that&rsquo;s fit for the future. We&rsquo;re rapidly transforming and integrating our businesses - Ports and Terminals, Marine Services, Logistics and Technology &ndash; and uniting our global infrastructure with local expertise to create stronger, more efficient end-to-end supply chain solutions that can change the way the world trades.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Controller, Inventory (Order Processing)

Job Location:&nbsp;Sokoto

Job Function


	This role involves functional responsibility to the Customer Service Manager for several key aspects of inventory management and workflow optimization in a warehouse setting.
	This includes maintaining electronic inventory records on ERPs such as SAP and ELM.
	Key responsibilities also include providing necessary information to optimize warehouse workflow, posting receipts and waybills, raising issue notes and invoices, and conducting stock reconciliation.


Key Performance Areas
Order Fulfilment:


	Posts stock transactions on WMS or ERP in accordance with clients&rsquo; SOPs.
	Ensuring real time posting of all receipts/waybills, issues/invoices into the system.
	Ensures tracing and documentation of waybills/invoices/stock issue notes raised for tracking or audit.
	Ensure the appropriate allocation of storage locations to support proper warehouse arrangement and optimize space utilization in the warehouse.
	Ensure to process orders from client: from point of receipt to issuance on warehouse ERP.
	Issue warehouse stocks to fill requisitions as required.
	In conjunction with the CSM and clients&rsquo; representatives, establish delivery priorities and delivery destination points through coordinated activities.
	In conjunction with the Quality Assurance Pharmacist/CSM update stock expiry status (Stock Expiry Reports), damaged, expired stock etc and effect WMS transition into the damaged/expired status before physical movement of affected stocks in the quarantine bay.


Stock Management &amp; Reporting:


	Support in preparing documentation for physical inventory checks on a regular basis and resolving inventory discrepancies promptly as may be required.
	Investigates stock discrepancies against the system record.
	Escalate to CSM all observed discrepancies in cycle count and stock count reconciliations within 24 hours.
	Reconciling and correcting stock discrepancies as may be directed by the CSM.
	Track and report on stock shelf life (Expiry report) to the clients.
	Prepares consolidated reports and update clients on daily/weekly/monthly bases with respect to stock balance (on sellable/usable, expired, and damaged) as may be directed by the CSM.


Assets:


	Ensure the protection of the company&rsquo;s assets against careless handling and fraudulent practices.


HSE:


	Shall promote a culture of safety and align with MDS HSEQ policy and guidelines.
	Participation in TQS and HSE meetings and carrying out our agreed action points.


Requirements
Qualifications Required:


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree/&nbsp; HND in Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, Logistics, or any related field.


Experience and Skills Required:


	Minimum of 1 - 2 years of post-qualification experience in warehousing, inventory management, supply chain operations, and customer service.
	WMS experience.
	Inventory management.
	Process or workflow management.
	Order fulfilment.
	Proficient with the Microsoft Office suite or related software.

Controller, Inventory (Order Processing) Job at DP World




        
    

        
        DP World - We exist to make the world’s trade flow better, changing what’s possible for the customers and communities we serve globally. With a dedicated, diverse and professional team of more than 108,100 employees spanning 74 countries on six continents. We are pushing trade further and faster towards a seamless supply chain that’s fit for the future. We’re rapidly transforming and integrating our businesses - Ports and Terminals, Marine Services, Logistics and Technology – and uniting our global infrastructure with local expertise to create stronger, more efficient end-to-end supply chain solutions that can change the way the world trades.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

            
    



Job Position: Controller, Inventory (Order Processing)

Job Location: Sokoto

Job Function


	This role involves functional responsibility to the Customer Service Manager for several key aspects of inventory management and workflow optimization in a warehouse setting.
	This includes maintaining electronic inventory records on ERPs such as SAP and ELM.
	Key responsibilities also include providing necessary information to optimize warehouse workflow, posting receipts and waybills, raising issue notes and invoices, and conducting stock reconciliation.


Key Performance Areas
Order Fulfilment:


	Posts stock transactions on WMS or ERP in accordance with clients’ SOPs.
	Ensuring real time posting of all receipts/waybills, issues/invoices into the system.
	Ensures tracing and documentation of waybills/invoices/stock issue notes raised for tracking or audit.
	Ensure the appropriate allocation of storage locations to support proper warehouse arrangement and optimize space utilization in the warehouse.
	Ensure to process orders from client: from point of receipt to issuance on warehouse ERP.
	Issue warehouse stocks to fill requisitions as required.
	In conjunction with the CSM and clients’ representatives, establish delivery priorities and delivery destination points through coordinated activities.
	In conjunction with the Quality Assurance Pharmacist/CSM update stock expiry status (Stock Expiry Reports), damaged, expired stock etc and effect WMS transition into the damaged/expired status before physical movement of affected stocks in the quarantine bay.


Stock Management & Reporting:


	Support in preparing documentation for physical inventory checks on a regular basis and resolving inventory discrepancies promptly as may be required.
	Investigates stock discrepancies against the system record.
	Escalate to CSM all observed discrepancies in cycle count and stock count reconciliations within 24 hours.
	Reconciling and correcting stock discrepancies as may be directed by the CSM.
	Track and report on stock shelf life (Expiry report) to the clients.
	Prepares consolidated reports and update clients on daily/weekly/monthly bases with respect to stock balance (on sellable/usable, expired, and damaged) as may be directed by the CSM.


Assets:


	Ensure the protection of the company’s assets against careless handling and fraudulent practices.


HSE:


	Shall promote a culture of safety and align with MDS HSEQ policy and guidelines.
	Participation in TQS and HSE meetings and carrying out our agreed action points.


Requirements
Qualifications Required:


	Bachelor’s Degree/  HND in Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, Logistics, or any related field.


Experience and Skills Required:


	Minimum of 1 - 2 years of post-qualification experience in warehousing, inventory management, supply chain operations, and customer service.
	WMS experience.
	Inventory management.
	Process or workflow management.
	Order fulfilment.
	Proficient with the Microsoft Office suite or related software.

Regional Operations & Display Manager Job at Transsion Holdings




        
    

        
        Transsion is a Chinese manufacturer of mobile phones and other consumer electronics, primarily known for its strong presence in emerging markets, particularly in Africa.The company owns popular mobile phone brands like Tecno, Infinix,and itel. In addition to mobile phones, Transsion also offers smart accessories (Oraimo) and home appliances (Syinix).

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Regional Operations & Display Manager

Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role
     

            
    




	Itel is seeking a dynamic and detail-oriented Regional Operations & Display Manager to lead store operations and visual merchandising efforts in the Ibadan region.
	This role will oversee the implementation of display standards, store activities, and the management of promotional assets to ensure a consistent and engaging customer experience across all Itel Home Stores.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead the learning, promotion, implementation, and rectification of in-store display standards across all regional stores.
	Coordinate the application, distribution, and monitoring of store gifts, marketing materials, props, and product prototypes.
	Develop and execute store-level activity plans, working closely with the marketing and sales teams to ensure alignment and timely execution.
	Monitor and implement all store-based operational tasks, ensuring operational excellence and brand consistency.
	Regularly audit store performance, identify gaps, and recommend actionable improvements.
	Support new store openings with operational planning, display setup, and promotional alignment.
	Train store staff on Itel’s standard operating procedures (SOPs) and visual merchandising best practices.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or related discipline.
	2 - 4 years of experience in retail operations, visual merchandising, or regional field management.
	Strong organizational, planning, and execution skills.
	Good communication and leadership ability.
	Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and reporting tools.
	Ability to travel frequently within the Ibadan region.


What We Offer


	Opportunity to lead operational growth in a key business region.
	A dynamic and supportive work culture focused on retail innovation.
	A chance to grow with one of Africa’s leading smartphone brands.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: faith.ogunleye@transsion.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Business Development and Operations Manager Job at InkedMemory.io




        
    

        
        At Inked Memory.io, we believe every life is a masterpiece, every story a treasure. Our purpose is to help families captureand preserve meaningful memories with beautifully crafted journals that inspire reflection and connection across generations. Through our thoughtfully designed products, we transform fleeting moments into timeless keepsakes that honor the people who shape our lives.

Our memory journals are more than just books—they’re bridges that connect generations, celebrating love, resilience, and the human experience.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development and Operations Manager

Job Location: Lagos
     

            
    



Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute sales strategies to achieve and exceed revenue targets.
	Identify new business opportunities, partnerships, and markets to expand Inked Memory’s reach.
	Build and maintain strong client relationships to ensure repeat business and referrals.
	Prepare and present proposals, pitches, and sales reports to management.
	Work with the creative team to ensure consistent branding across all channels.
	Lead, motivate, and support sales/marketing team members to achieve departmental goals.
	Coordinate with cross-functional teams (content, design, operations) to deliver on marketing initiatives.
	Create and manage integrated marketing campaigns to promote products, services, and brand awareness.
	Oversee digital marketing efforts, including social media, SEO, content marketing, email campaigns, and paid advertising.
	Analyze market trends and competitors to adapt strategies for better positioning.
	Manage marketing budget effectively and optimize for ROI.
	Track KPIs and provide regular reports onlead generationand sales performance.
	Use analytics and market insights to refine sales and marketing approaches.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Communications, or a related field.
	3 - 6 years of proven experience in sales and marketing, preferably in a creative or consumer-driven industry.
	Strong understanding of digital marketing, branding, and customer acquisition strategies.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
	Proven track record of achieving sales targets and growing market presence.
	Ability to lead a team and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
